Articles.Content:
Came across this rather fun Woody Woodpecker film about how to get a rocket to the Moon and back. It's a couple of minutes into this film clip. There's a couple of oddities with the terminology and thinking but I suppose it was supposed to serve a dumbed down purpose in the movie... 

 

Edited February 27, 2016 by Foxster
That was an interesting bit of history! Thanks for linking to it.
Not really about KSP, moved to the Lounge.

Ah, Destination Moon, I'd thought nobody remembered that. Although I am told that NASA apparently updated and continued to use the clip for public education. A shame that the movie itself lost out to a movie like Rocketship X-M, but that's the movie for you. I initially heard of Destination Moon mostly through a some writing in one of Robert Heinlien's book of collected works.

Having watched this clip I checked and found the full movie on youtube. It's actually not bad in terms of sticking to something pretty realistic i.e. no silly space ships or bug-eyed monsters. 

I also liked that it was really obvious the thing was way overweight at launch and that led to the ending when that became a major issue.
